intro: Carduus inamoenus, commonly known as the woolly thistle, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny, hairy leaves and purple to pink flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It has a robust root system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. The woolly thistle is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat various ailments.
